segment.name: Beginning of message
segment.documentation: BGM, A segment by which the sender must uniquely identify the invoice by means of its type and number and when necessary its function.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation:
DTM, A segment specifying general dates and, when relevant, times related to the whole message. The segment must be specified at least once to identify the invoice date. Examples of the use of this DTM segment is: "shipped on date" or "delivery date".
The Date/time/period segment within other Segment groups should be used whenever the date/time/period requires to be logically related to another specified data item e.g. Payment due date is specified within the PAT Segment group.

segment.name: Payment instructions
segment.documentation: PAI, A segment requesting or confirming conditions of payment, guarantee and method of payment for the whole invoice. An example of the use of this segment is to specify the type of documentary credit used in the transaction.

segment.name: Additional information
segment.documentation: ALI, A segment indicating special conditions related to the total invoice owing to origin, customs preference or other commercial factors.

segment.name: Item description
segment.documentation: IMD, A segment providing a description common to all line items of the invoice.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, used when additional information is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments for giving references and where necessary, their dates, relating to the whole message, e.g. contract number, import/export license number, despatch advice number.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the reference by its number and where appropriate a line number within a document.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date/time related to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments identifying the parties with associated information.

segment.name: Name and address
segment.documentation: NAD, A segment identifying names and addresses of the parties, in coded or clear form, and their functions relevant to the invoice. Identification of the seller and buyer parties is mandatory for the invoice message. It is recommended that where possible only the coded form of the party ID should be specified e.g. The Buyer and Seller are known to each other, thus only the coded ID is required, but the Consignee or Delivery address may vary and would have to be clearly specified, preferably in structured format.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment giving more specific location information of the party specified in the NAD segment e.g. internal site/building number.

segment.name: Financial institution information
segment.documentation: FII, A segment identifying the financial institution (e.g. bank) and relevant account numbers for the seller, buyer and where necessary other parties.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segment for giving references only relevant to the specified party rather than the whole invoice.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the reference by its number and where appropriate a line number within a document.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date and/or time related to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments identifying the documentary requirements of the specified party.

segment.name: Document/message details
segment.documentation: DOC, A segment identifying and providing information relating to the documents required by the party specified by the NAD segment.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date and/or time of the document.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments giving contact details of the specific person or department within the party identified in the NAD segment.

segment.name: Contact information
segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department, and their function, to whom communications should be directed.

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation: COM, A segment to identify a communications type and number for the contact specified in the CTA segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments specifying tax related information, and when necessary, the location(s) to which that tax information relates.

segment.name: Duty/tax/fee details
segment.documentation: TAX, A segment specifying a tax type, category and rate or exemption, relating to the whole invoice e.g. Value Added Tax at the standard rate is applicable for all items.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment specifying the amount for the identified tax/fee.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment indicating the location to which the tax or exemption specified in the TAX segment applies, e.g. city or state or country tax.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segments specifying the currencies and related dates/periods valid for the whole invoice. Currency data maybe omitted in national applications but will be required for international transactions.

segment.name: Currencies
segment.documentation: CUX, A segment identifying the currencies required in the invoice e.g. the invoice currency. A rate of exchange may be given to convert a reference currency into a target currency.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date/time/period related to the rate of exchange.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 8: A group of segments specifying the terms of payment applicable for the whole invoice.

segment.name: Payment terms basis
segment.documentation: PAT, A segment identifying the payment terms and date/time basis.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment giving the specific date/time/period, if needed, of any payments, discounts, installments etc.

segment.name: Percentage details
segment.documentation: PCD, A segment specifying the discount, interest, penalty as well as installment percentage.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment specifying amounts related to payment discount penalties or installments.

segment.name: Payment instructions
segment.documentation: PAI, To specify the instructions for payment.

segment.name: Financial institution information
segment.documentation: FII, To identify an account and a related financial institution.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 9: A group of segments identifying the mode and means of transport, location and relevant dates and times for transportation, relating to the whole invoice.

segment.name: Details of transport
segment.documentation: TDT, A segment specifying the mode, means and identification of the transport for the goods being invoiced.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 10: A group of segments giving the location and date/time information relative to the transportation.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment identifying locations relevant to the transport specified in the TDT segment e.g. place of departure or border crossing point.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment identifying the date/time details of departure and/or arrival of the transported goods for the specified location.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 11: A group of segments to allow reference to transport details.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment giving reference to transport details.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment giving date/time/period on the above reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 12: A group of segments indicating the terms of delivery for the whole invoice.

segment.name: Terms of delivery or transport
segment.documentation: TOD, A segment identifying the delivery terms used e.g. INCOTERMS, code could be used to specify the delivery terms.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment identifying locations relevant to the delivery terms specified in the TOD segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 13: A group of segments identifying the packaging, physical dimensions and marks and numbers for goods referenced by the whole invoice.

segment.name: Package
segment.documentation: PAC, A segment specifying the number and type of packages for the whole invoice, e.g. number and type of pallets.

segment.name: Measurements
segment.documentation: MEA, A segment specifying physical measurements of packages described in the PAC segment. e.g. package length, weight.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 14: A group of segments specifying the markings and labels on individual physical units.

segment.name: Package identification
segment.documentation: PCI, A segment specifying markings and labels used on individual physical units (packages) described in the PAC segment.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the master label number.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the dates relevant to the package markings.

segment.name: Goods identity number
segment.documentation: GIN, A segment identifying the number or ranges of numbers for use with the package markings.

segmentGroup.documentation:
Segment group 15: A group of segments specifying allowances and charges for the whole invoice. The allowance or charge specified within this Segment group may either relate to the total invoice in which case it cannot be overridden at detail level, or it can relate to the line items as a default allowance/charge and can be overridden by the ALC Segment group within the detail section. Where relevant, additional information, tax and alternate currency details are to be indicated in the TAX and MOA segments.
The basis for the calculation of the allowance/charge may be a quantity, a percentage, an amount or a rate and one of the Segment group 15-19 should be used accordingly.

segment.name: Allowance or charge
segment.documentation: ALC, A segment identifying the charge or allowance and, where necessary, its calculation sequence.

segment.name: Additional information
segment.documentation: ALI, A segment indicating that allowance or charge specified is subject to special conditions owing to origin, customs preference or commercial factors.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 16: A group of segment for giving references and where necessary, their dates relating to the allowances or charges.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the reference by its number and where appropriate a line number within a document.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date and/or time related to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 17: A group of segments specifying the quantity of the allowance or charge with its measure unit specifier. A range to which the allowance or charge applies may be specified e.g. An allowance of a free quantity of 20 pieces may be specified if the goods quantity ordered is greater than 1000 pieces.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, A segment identifying the type of quantity and the quantity related to the allowance or charge.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, A segment specifying, if required, the range to which the allowance or charge applies.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 18: A group of segments specifying the percentage for the allowance or charge, e.g. The allowance/charge amount is calculated as 5% of the goods value or a price reduction of 5% may be specified if the goods quantity ordered is within the range 5 tons to 10 tons.

segment.name: Percentage details
segment.documentation: PCD, A segment identifying the percentage and the percentage basis for the calculation of the allowance or charge.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, A segment specifying, if required, a range for the application of the percentage.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 19: A group of segments specifying a monetary amount for an allowance or charge. A range to which the allowance or charge applies can be specified, e.g. an allowance of 5000 BEF may be specified if goods value ordered is greater than 100000 BEF.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment identifying the monetary amount for the allowance or charge.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, A segment specifying, if required, a range for the application of the allowance/charge amount.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 20: A group of segments specifying the rate per unit and basis to which the allowance or charge applies, e.g. the allowance/charge amount is 3 DEM per 10 tons.

segment.name: Rate details
segment.documentation: RTE, A segment specifying the rate per unit and the basis for calculation.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, A segment specifying, if required, the range for the application of the allowance/charge rate.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 21: A group of segments specifying tax related information for the allowance or charge and, when necessary.

segment.name: Duty/tax/fee details
segment.documentation: TAX, A segment specifying the tax type, category and rate, or exemption, related to the allowance or charge.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment specifying the amount for the allowance or charge.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 22: A group of segments identifying any rules, laws or regulations with which the supplier must comply to meet requirements e.g. building regulations, safety requirements, etc.

segment.name: Requirements and conditions
segment.documentation: RCS, A segment to enable industry or national requirements to be specified.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the referenced document by its number and, where appropriate, a line number.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date/time related to the reference.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, used when additional information is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 23: A segment group to give information about adjustment.

segment.name: Adjustment details
segment.documentation: AJT, A segment giving adjustment details.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment giving additional information on the adjustment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 24: A segment group giving the possibility in a reply to INVOIC of instructing the other party of the action to be taken.

segment.name: Parties to instruction
segment.documentation: INP, A segment giving information on parties to instruction.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation:
FTX, A segment giving additional information about parties to instruction.
4.1.2 Detail section
Information to be provided in the Detail section:

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 25: EQD-FTX-SG26-SG27-SG28-SG29-SG30-SG32-SG33- SG34-SG38-SG44-SG46-SG47 A group of segments providing details of the individual invoiced items. There must be at least one occurrence of Segment group 22 within an invoice, but not necessarily in a credit note or a debit note. This Segment group may be repeated to give sub-line details.

segment.name: Line item
segment.documentation: LIN, A segment identifying the line item by the line number and configuration level, and additionally, identifying the product or service invoiced. Other product identification numbers, e.g. Buyer product number etc., can be specified within the following PIA segment.

segment.name: Additional product id
segment.documentation: PIA, A segment providing either additional identification to the product specified in the LIN segment (e.g. Harmonized System number), or provides any substitute product identification.

segment.name: Item description
segment.documentation: IMD, A segment for describing the product or service being invoiced as well as product characteristic. This segment should be used for products or services that cannot be fully identified by a product code or article number.

segment.name: Measurements
segment.documentation: MEA, A segment enabling the physical measurements of the invoiced item to be specified where this is required for full identification of the product. Any measurements must refer to the product in its unpacked form e.g. thickness of plastic film, length, weight, etc.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, A segment identifying the product quantities e.g. invoiced quantity.

segment.name: Percentage details
segment.documentation: PCD, A segment specifying the strength or yield of a product as a percentage e.g. 80% to indicate the strength of an Acid.

segment.name: Additional information
segment.documentation: ALI, A segment indicating that the line item is subject to special conditions owing to origin, customs preference, embargo regulations or commercial factors.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying date/time/period details relating to the line item only.

segment.name: Goods identity number
segment.documentation: GIN, A segment providing identity numbers to be applied to the goods being invoiced, e.g. serial numbers for assembled equipment.

segment.name: Related identification numbers
segment.documentation: GIR, A segment providing sets of related identification numbers for a line item, e.g. engine numbers, chassis number and transmission number for a vehicle.

segment.name: Quantity variances
segment.documentation: QVR, A segment identifying quantity variances, between, e.g. quantity delivered/invoiced and quantity ordered.

segment.name: Equipment details
segment.documentation: EQD, A segment to specify the type and size of equipment being billed.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, used when additional information is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 26: A group of segments specifying any monetary amounts relating to the products and when necessary a currency.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment specifying any monetary amounts relating to the product, e.g. item amount, insurance value, customs value.

segment.name: Currencies
segment.documentation: CUX, A segment identifying the currencies required in the line item, when is different from the heading currencies. A rate of exchange may given to convert a reference currency into a target currency.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 27: A group of segments specifying the terms of payment for the line item where this is different to that specified in the heading section.

segment.name: Payment terms basis
segment.documentation: PAT, A segment identifying the payment terms and date/time basis.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment giving the specific date/time/period, if needed, of any payments, discounts, installments etc.

segment.name: Percentage details
segment.documentation: PCD, A segment specifying discount, interest, penalty as well as installment percentage.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment specifying amounts related to payment discount penalties or installments.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 28: A group of segments identifying the relevant pricing information for the goods or services invoiced.

segment.name: Price details
segment.documentation: PRI, A segment to specify the price type and amount. The price used in the calculation of the line amount will be identified as 'Price'. Indication of "net price" or "gross price" can be given in 5387 "Price type qualifier".

segment.name: Additional price information
segment.documentation: APR, A segment to identify pricing information such as a price multiplier, the class or type of trade and additionally identifying the reason for any changes.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, A segment to identify the ranges(quantity, amount, etc.) to which the additional price information applies.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment to identify the date/time/period information related to the price change. e.g. period of validity.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 29: A group giving references and where necessary, their dates, relating to the line item.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the reference by its number and where appropriate a line number within a document.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date/time related to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 30: A group of segments identifying the packaging, physical dimensions, and marks and numbers for goods referenced in the line item.

segment.name: Package
segment.documentation: PAC, A segment specifying the number and type of packages for the line item, e.g. number and type of pallets.

segment.name: Measurements
segment.documentation: MEA, A segment specifying physical measurements of packages described in the PAC segment e.g. package length, weight.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 31: A group of segments specifying the markings and labels on individual physical units.

segment.name: Package identification
segment.documentation: PCI, A segment specifying markings and labels used on individual physical units (packages) described in the PAC segment.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the master label number.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the dates relevant to the package markings.

segment.name: Goods identity number
segment.documentation: GIN, A segment identifying the number or ranges of numbers for use with the package markings.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 32: A group of segments specifying destination and quantity details for consignments involving multi-destination deliveries for a specified line item.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment indicating the location to which part of the consignment has been delivered.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, A segment specifying the quantity delivered to the identified location.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the dates and/or times that the delivery has been made.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 33: A group of segments specifying tax related information for the line item, and when necessary, the location(s) to which that tax information relates.

segment.name: Duty/tax/fee details
segment.documentation: TAX, A segment specifying a tax type, category and rate, or exemption, relating to the line item.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment specifying the amount for the identified tax/fee.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment indicating the location to which the tax or exemption specified in the TAX segment applies, e.g. city or state or country tax.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 34: A group of segments identifying the parties with associated information, relevant to the line item only.

segment.name: Name and address
segment.documentation:
NAD, A segment identifying names and addresses of the parties, in coded or clear form, and their functions relevant to the line item.
It is recommended that where possible only the coded form of the party ID should be specified e.g. The Buyer and Seller are known to each other, thus only the coded ID is required, but the Consignee or Delivery address may vary and would have to be clearly specified, preferably in structured format.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment giving more specific location information of the party specified in the NAD segment e.g. internal site/building number.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 35: A group of segment for giving references only relevant to the specified party rather than the whole line item.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the reference by its number and where appropriate a line number within a document.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date and/or time related to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 36: A group of segments identifying the documentary requirements of the specified party.

segment.name: Document/message details
segment.documentation: DOC, A segment identifying and providing information relating to the documents required by the party specified by the NAD segment.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date and/or time of the document.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 37: A group of segments giving contact details of the specific person or department within the party identified in the NAD segment.

segment.name: Contact information
segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department, and their function, to whom communications should be directed.

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation: COM, A segment to identify a communications type and number for the contact specified in the CTA segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 38: A group of segments specifying allowances and charges for the line item where this is different to or not specified within the heading section.

segment.name: Allowance or charge
segment.documentation: ALC, A segment identifying the charge or allowance and, where necessary its calculation sequence.

segment.name: Additional information
segment.documentation: ALI, A segment indicating that allowance or charge specified is subject to special conditions owing to origin, customs preference or commercial factors.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, To specify date, and/or time, or period.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 39: A group of segments specifying the quantity of the allowance or charge with its measure unit specifier. A range to which the allowance or charge applies may be specified e.g. An allowance of a free quantity of 20 pieces may be specified if the goods quantity ordered is greater than 1000 pieces.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, A segment identifying the type of quantity and the quantity related to the allowance or charge.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, A segment specifying, if required, the range to which the allowance or charge applies.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 40: A group of segments specifying the percentage for the allowance or charge, e.g. The allowance/charge amount is calculated as 5% of the goods value or a price reduction of 5% may be specified if the goods quantity ordered is within the range 5 tons to 10 tons.

segment.name: Percentage details
segment.documentation: PCD, A segment identifying the percentage and the percentage basis for the calculation of the allowance or charge.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, A segment specifying, if required, a range for the application of the percentage.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 41: A group of segments specifying a monetary amount for an allowance or charge. A range to which the allowance or charge applies can be specified, e.g. an allowance of 5000 BEF may be specified if goods value ordered is greater than 100000 BEF.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment identifying the monetary amount for the allowance or charge.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, A segment specifying, if required, a range for the application of the allowance/charge amount.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 42: A group of segments specifying the rate per unit and basis to which the allowance or charge applies, e.g. The allowance/charge amount is 3 DEM per 10 tons.

segment.name: Rate details
segment.documentation: RTE, A segment specifying the rate per unit and the basis for calculation.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, A segment specifying, if required, the range for the application of the allowance/charge rate.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 43: A group of segments specifying tax related information for the allowance or charge and, when necessary.

segment.name: Duty/tax/fee details
segment.documentation: TAX, A segment specifying the tax type, category, and rate, or exemption, related to the allowance or charge.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment specifying the amount for the allowance or charge.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 44: A group of segments identifying the mode and means of transport, location and relevant dates and times for transportation, relating to the line item, where this is different to or not specified within the heading section.

segment.name: Details of transport
segment.documentation: TDT, A segment specifying the mode, means and identification of the transport for the goods in the line item.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 45: A group of segments giving the location and date/time information relative to the transportation.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment identifying locations relevant to the transport specified in the TDT segment e.g. place of departure or border crossing point.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment identifying the date/time details of departure and/or arrival of the transported goods for the specified location.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 46: A group of segments indicating the terms of delivery for the line item where this is different to or not specified within the heading section.

segment.name: Terms of delivery or transport
segment.documentation: TOD, A segment identifying the delivery terms used. e.g. INCOTERMS, code could be used to specify the delivery terms.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment identifying locations relevant to the delivery terms specified in the TOD segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 47: A group of segments identifying for the line item - where this is different to or not specified within the Heading section - any rules, laws or regulations with which the supplier must comply to meet requirements. e.g. building regulations, safety requirements etc.

segment.name: Requirements and conditions
segment.documentation: RCS, A segment to enable industry or national requirements to be specified.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the referenced document by its number and, where appropriate, a line number.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date/time related to the reference.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation:
FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, used when additional information is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.
4.1.3 Summary section
Information to be provided in the Summary section:

segment.name: Section control
segment.documentation: UNS, A service segment placed at the start of the summary section to avoid segment collision.

segment.name: Control total
segment.documentation: CNT, A segment by which control totals may be provided by the sender for checking by the receiver.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 48: A group of segments giving total amounts for the whole invoice and - if relevant -detailing amounts pre-paid with relevant references and dates-

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment giving the total amounts for the whole invoice message such as message monetary amount, message line item total amount, amount subject to payment discount, amount subject to tax, alternative currency total amount, total additional amount, sub-total amounts prepaid, total amount prepaid.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 49: A group of segments for giving references and where necessary, their dates, relating e.g. amounts prepaid number.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the reference by its number and where appropriate a line number within a document.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date/time related to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 50: A group of segments specifying taxes totals for the invoice.

segment.name: Duty/tax/fee details
segment.documentation: TAX, A segment specifying the tax type to be summarized.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment specifying the summary amount for the tax specified.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 51: A group of segments specifying allowances and charges summary totals for the invoice.

segment.name: Allowance or charge
segment.documentation: ALC, A segment identifying the charge or allowance type to be summarised.

segment.name: Additional information
segment.documentation: ALI, A segment indicating that allowance or charge specified is subject to special conditions owing to origin, customs preference or commercial factors.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment specifying the summary amount for the allowance or charge.
